skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Loyal, fierce, powerful and surprisingly fast â€“ a War Bear is a symbol of Kislev itself.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Champions know there is glory in striking down great foes, but battles are more often won by the many and not the few.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Many foes have broken upon the frozen ramparts of Kislev, and for every anvil there must be a hammer.

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

skillTree.localised_description: Harden your heart with glacial resolve.

effects.description: Effect range: +100% to "Rally!" and "Stand Your Ground"

skillTree.localised_description: At the core of Kislevite doctrine, the storm of steel.

effects.description:
Speed: +25% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +16% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What is the bite of an arrow to the freezing sting of a northern hailstorm?

effects.description:
Attribute: Directional Armour for Kislevite units with shields
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text:
This unit has variable  Missile Block Chance depending on which side of the unit is hit by a projectile.
	
	The missile block chance multiplier of each direction is:
	 1.0x at the front
	 0.5x at the sides
	 0.1x at the rear

effects.description:
Missile block chance: +15% for Kislevite units with bronze level shields
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Battle is the crucible in which Heroes are forged.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some men are natural leaders, born to foster and marshal their tribes through devastating wars and the harshest of winters.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when in own territory
	(all units in army)

Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Kislev units
	(when in own territory)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: For those used to life in the oblasts, keeping the elements out is only the beginning of the measures they must take to ensure the survival of their people.
This valorous warrior has been at the forefront of the struggle against Ruin before, and they certainly shall be again, steeled and girded by that dreadful experience.

effects.description:
Leadership +4 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description:
Leadership +4 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: By right of his storied experience, this one is trusted to make sound judgements in the best interests of the Motherland.
The ancient Khan-Queen Miska practised Ice Magic to the very highest grade; this one studies her methods in the hope of attaining similar greatness.

effects.description: Ice Court Support gained: +3 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
